alert.note: Alert for Northwest Deserts (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued December 14 at 12:11PM MST until December 14 at 11:00PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE FLAG BURN AREA IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall are possible over the Flag Burn Area. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Arizona, including the following area, Flag Burn Area. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 11 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the Flag Burn Area is expected during the period of the watch. Residents near the Flag Burn Area including Pine Lake and Hualapai Mountain Park should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, rapidly running washes, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the Flag Burn Area later this afternoon and during the evening, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
